title: Rizzo Understands Pain
theme: Everyone has something they care about
plot_outline: Rizzo's carefully constructed solitude is disrupted when they're forced to interact with a social worker with good intentions. As secret revealed at worst time, both characters must confront their issues with trust, intimacy, and the fact that everyone has something they care about.

scenes.title: Rock Bottom Has a Basement
scenes.action: Rizzo begins their day with the usual routine of avoiding responsibility and managing expectations. The catalyst for today's adventure presents itself in the form of a minor emergency that requires leaving their comfort zone. Despite every instinct screaming "don't get involved," circumstances and poor judgment combine to draw Rizzo into the situation.

dialogue.speaker: Rizzo
dialogue.line: Death would be preferable to whatever you're about to ask.
dialogue.tone: dark humor as a defense mechanism against trauma
dialogue.subtext: testing whether this person can be trusted

dialogue.speaker: Rizzo
dialogue.line: Why does this always happen?
dialogue.tone: dark humor as a defense mechanism against trauma
dialogue.subtext: terrified of being vulnerable again

dialogue.speaker: Rizzo
dialogue.line: Things just keep getting worse.
dialogue.tone: dark humor as a defense mechanism against trauma
dialogue.subtext: desperately wants to be proven wrong about people

dialogue.speaker: Eddie the Pawn Shop Owner
dialogue.line: At least it's over.
dialogue.tone: weary sarcasm
dialogue.subtext: testing whether this person can be trusted

visual_details.setting_description: A place where life happens to people who've stopped trying to control it

character_appearances.Slumlord Jenkins: Tired, worn down, but still clinging to whatever dignity remains

scenes.title: When Bad Gets Worse
scenes.action: The situation escalates when a misunderstanding escalates out of control. What seemed like a manageable problem reveals itself to be connected to larger issues involving systemic inequality. Rizzo realizes they're in deeper than anticipated and that their usual strategy of "ignore it and hope it goes away" won't work this time.

scenes.title: Same Shit, Different Day
scenes.action: The episode concludes with Rizzo having learned nothing from their experience but somehow finding themselves in a slightly different variation of the same situation they started in. Victory is redefined as "not making things significantly worse," and the audience is reminded that some problems don't get solvedâ€”they just get replaced with new problems.
